abstract: Kraft plans to offer more cash in its hostile takeover bid for the British chocolate maker, using the proceeds from a sale of its frozen pizza business.
snippet: Kraft plans to offer more cash in its hostile takeover bid for the British chocolate maker, using the proceeds from a sale of its frozen pizza business.
lead_paragraph: Kraft Foods took a big step on Tuesday to shore up its $16 billion hostile bid for Cadbury, the British confectioner, by selling one of its most profitable units to Nestlé.

headline.main: Kraft Bolsters Its Hostile Bid for Cadbury by Raising New Cash
headline.print_headline: Kraft Bolsters Its Hostile Bid for Cadbury by Raising New Cash

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Chris V. Nicholson

abstract: Kraft Foods took a big step on Tuesday to shore up its $16 billion hostile bid for Cadbury, the British confectioner, by selling one of its most profitable units to Nestlé, but Kraft’s largest shareholder, Berkshire Hathaway, urged the company to be cautious.
snippet: Kraft Foods took a big step on Tuesday to shore up its $16 billion hostile bid for Cadbury, the British confectioner, by selling one of its most profitable units to Nestlé, but Kraft’s largest shareholder, Berkshire Hathaway, urged the company to ...
lead_paragraph: Kraft Foods took a big step on Tuesday to shore up its $16 billion hostile bid for Cadbury, the British confectioner, by selling one of its most profitable units to Nestlé.

headline.main: Kraft Bolsters Bid for Cadbury by Raising New Cash

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Chris V. Nicholson

abstract: Shares in Cadbury slid a second day to just above Kraft’s hostile bid, as Nestlé bowed out of the race for the British confectioner and Warren E. Buffett tamped down expectations of a higher offer from the American food giant.
snippet: Shares in Cadbury slid a second day to just above Kraft’s hostile bid, as Nestlé bowed out of the race for the British confectioner and Warren E. Buffett tamped down expectations of a higher offer from the American food giant.
lead_paragraph: Update | 9:52 a.m. Shares in Kraft dropped 2 percent to $28.18 in early morning trading on Wednesday, once again opening up the spread between its bid and Cadbury’s share price.

headline.main: Cadbury Shares Slide Toward Kraft Offer

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Shares in Cadbury fell again on Wednesday, edging closer to the level of Kraft’s $16 billion hostile takeover offer for the British confectioner. Meanwhile, some Cadbury directors have continued to hold back-channel talks with counterparts at Hershey over a potential rival bid.
snippet: Shares in Cadbury fell again on Wednesday, edging closer to the level of Kraft’s $16 billion hostile takeover offer for the British confectioner. Meanwhile, some Cadbury directors have continued to hold back-channel talks with counterparts at Hers...
lead_paragraph: Shares in Cadbury fell again on Wednesday, edging closer to the level of Kraft‘s $16 billion hostile takeover offer.

headline.main: Cadbury Stock Price Draws Closer to Kraft’s Bid

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
